lines.text: The American frontier, late in the last century, was a hotbed of violence. It took daring, and desperate courage, for a frontiersman to survive - whether he lived by breaking the law, or by enforcing it. This is the 'true' story of three of these desperate men - 'true' not because it happened exactly as portrayed, but because human nature is what it is...
[first lines]
[the posse has cornered the men they've been pursuing]
Put that away! We don't want to shoot 'em.
Bill, look! The marshals!
Yep.
They'll never take me alive!

[pouring a cup of coffee]
Don't you want to drink the rest of it?
Are you loco?
I can't start the day without my coffee.
What is this?
It's from District Marshal Coleman. It's his statement that Matt was wearing a marshal's badge and working with him on the day of the train robbery.
Well this is pretty good evidence. I know Pete Coleman. Too bad you boys weren't at the trial.
At the trial? We just heard about it last week! Your justice is a lot faster than your railroad.
[Matt is about to be hung]
Do you want a blindfold, Matt?
No. If I'm going to perform, I want to see my audience.
Say, did you fellows come from town?
Yeah.
Did you see the hangin?
Naw, we couldn't wait.
I couldn't make it myself. Hated to miss it.
Yeah... So did I.
Wires to every town along the line. They'll never get home alive.
[thumbing through telegrams listing the Denton's alleged crimes]
Horse thieves, murderers, bank robbers, rustlers...
Pete, there'd have to be a hundred of them to do all those things!
You know how we got into this. We were forced to turn outlaw. All I wanted was a chance to give Laura a decent life somewhere else.
You mean to say you turned outlaw for Laura? Then you have no excuse for ever robbing or killing again. Laura is dead.
Fred, after today they'll forget all about the Youngers and the James boys; it'll be us! None of them ever took two places at once.
That's no reason.
It's reason enough for me now!
[a lovely woman smiles at Bill just before as the outlaws start the robbery]
I hope she don't have money in the bank.
